author: ebuckle
title: Investing in Africa
description: Africa and the Global South are getting smaller portions of Catalyst funding.

f6_assessments.q0: We observe that the objective of the project is well aligned with the goals of the challenge, since the agricultural problem in Africa is latent. In addition, as mentioned, this situation was further aggravated by the supply crisis with the war in Ukraine, which makes the search for innovative ways to align blockchain technology and the optimization of production techniques in the agricultural chain even more urgent. Clearly this is a very large problem to solve, but we noticed that skilled people are involved. With the success of this proposal, we will have both the improvement of a historic problem on the African continent and an increase in the visibility of Cardano's technologies to solve problems of this nature.
f6_assessments.q1: As mentioned before, we found highly qualified professionals and organizations behind the project, which increases our confidence in the chances of success of the project. The professionals involved are strongly related to the search for climatic and ecological solutions, especially in regions with a not very high degree of development. In addition, their CVs were made available so that their experiences could be verified. Another very positive point is the understanding of the breadth and number of agents that must be involved to improve the production chain. In line with this, we note that at this moment the focus will be on conducting research and establishing partnerships so that more specific solutions are implemented in the future. In this context, we can see in the details of the budget that most of the capital allocations are aimed at establishing partnerships and publicizing the project, which is quite consistent. The only thing left is the observation that it might be interesting to allocate a little more capital to the IT infrastructure and maintenance of the database, since a large amount of information will be handled. We also note in the budget breakdown, the total budget is higher than previously described.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding the ways chosen to monitor the success of the project, we have that relevant indicators and metrics have been established, especially the number of relationships built and local partnerships formed. However, it would be interesting if goals were established to better understand the level of engagement that the project achieved. With this, it could have been defined, for example, a number of partnerships to be conquered after a certain period of time. Furthermore, it would also be interesting to indicate the tool to be used to transmit the results to the community.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a well-intentioned proposal but it has weak ties to Cardano. It seems the team is trying to use the project catalyst to leverage an already existing project that originally had nothing to do with Cardano by adding some slight touches of Cardano in the proposal. Indeed, there are some intersections in the subjects discussed such as impact investing, but they don't go much beyond that. The goals of the campaign are to spread knowledge and adoption of Cardano in Africa, to increase the number of African projects seeded, to increase the percentage of contribution in the project catalyst coming from Africa-based members and to promote innovations that will tackle unique challenges faced by the continent. On the other hand, the main goal of the team's plan is to allow easier and quicker access to microcredit funding for entrepreneurs in Africa. However, they never explain how that will be done or how Cardano will be used to help achieve that.
f6_assessments.q1: The team described in composed of Antoinette, Bianca and Elise. All of the three are co-founders of SHE Changes Climate and have relevant experiences which are supported by evidence provided in the LinkedIn links in the proposal. The budget is broken down into reasonable and identifiable items and the amounts requested for each are sensible given the project duration and number of people involved. However, the total amount in the budget don't match with the requested funds in the beginning of the proposal. Also, the timetable described is realistic and the total duration estimated of the project is six months. Additionally, the plan described is sensible and conductible, they explain what they will be doing every month or so. Finally, the proposer has discussed three major risks the project faces and also how they intend to mitigate them. They are the risk of not delivering what they have promised, the risk of the targeted people not wanting to take the microcredit opportunity and the risk of not reaching the desired outcome. For the first one, for example, their solution is to partner with the Rallying Cry, which has a lot of experience in the space of microcredits in Africa.
f6_assessments.q2: The team didn't highlight the milestones of each stage of the plan, but have provided good explanations of what will be done at each phase. It's not a big fault but as a suggestion to enhance the proposal I would add explicit milestones in the plan. For instance, in the September phase they could have defined a milestone of publishing the open letter. Additionally, in the metrics they could have defined more precise KPIs. They used local impact and local partnerships formed as suggested in the campaign, but the impact referred in this case is user activity in the Cardano ecosystem which is something the proposal neglects. The same goes for local partnership, they don't really explain what Cardano-related partnerships they could foment. Finally, they have not clearly provided a public channel to update the community about their progress.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal seeks to raise partnerships and connections with investors who would interested in financing Africa based initiatives especially related to Agriculture and climate change. The proposal addresses the callenge in that it is geared towards a massive local impact of livelihoods in Africa, while encouraging onboarding and adoption of Cardano as the Blockchain of choice in Africa. There is a high probability that through the partnerships and knowledge sharing of this project many developers and passionate young people will come to know about Cardano and begin to participate massively in the ecosystem. This is a great idea.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has detailed the names and qualifications of team members and relevant links have been given as proofs to the experience and track record of the team. The proposer also list organizations and people the team seeks to partner with to use their expertise and experience to help achieve the success of this project and that is great. The budget is well detailed with itemized list of activities and expenditure. To me, for such a project the budget is in a reasonable limit. The proposal also present a well laid out plan with timelines to guide execution. This proposal if funded has a very high probability of been implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers do a great job to present the key performance indicators. They also presented what success looks like in a very concise, clear and understandable manner. The milestones with timelines are also presented to help track progress. Putting all these together, the proposal is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Catalyst is bringing onchain governance to the Cardano blockchain by allowing the community to self determine priorities for growth. It also let's participants deploy funding to proposals which tackle challenges and capitalise on opportunities that arise in the life cycle of Cardano. Project catalyst is divided into a series of funds which are deployed every six weeks. These funds will elicit ideas in the form of proposals from participants. Each proposal will focus around a challenge issued by the project catalyst or project catalyst community. Different investments in Africa offers diversity solutions to global food, climate and human rights crisis which allows accessible access to micro credit funding build diversity. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge and I agree with the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a detailed plan of 6months includes development and maintenance of high trust relationship, building nurturing community and relationships with stakeholders in Africa and continuing map out key stakeholders and building relationships with cardano community micro funding initiatives. Also includes feedback collection, lessons learned and key statistics to measure impact and preparing strategies to maintain relationships moving forward. The budget breakdown is feasible and reasonable to achieve set goals. The people working with the proposal has a good experience in it. Given experiences and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The project progress can be tracked by measuring the deliverables including marketing materials, leaders participants in events hosted by SC and exposure to cardano , media kit re cardano , network sessions with African stakeholders. The key metrics includes global intestines in work and previous projects received media coverage, local impact and partnerships formed , number of relationships built between African entrepreneur and investors. The proposer has considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation. The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal tells us that Africa and the Global South are receiving smaller portions of Catalyst funding, the solution to this problem is that we will be diversifying investments to deliver multiple solutions. for the global food, climate, and human rights crisis. So how to be more diversified investments? The group sees African entrepreneurs as a key player in food production and can be a multi-pronged solution to enhancing the resilience of people and communities to cope with climate change. crisis, because of this, entrepreneurs in Africa will have easier and faster access to capital in the form of microcredit. The group also proposes, in collaboration with Rallying Cry, (SCC) to catalyze investment to develop and scale climate-smart businesses across agricultural value chains in Africa. This work will support the development of financial instruments tailored to the needs of African entrepreneurs.
There is no doubt, that the solutions from the proposed team are so clear and it is perfectly suited to solve the challenge as the fund will focus and offer strategies on how to promote blockchain, impact investment climate technology investment, and development in the Global South.
The group also outlined the risks of this project and the solutions to those risks. However, these disarmaments are just showing the community that they will do those jobs, not giving the final result that the risk will be completely resolved.
f6_assessments.q1:
The group showed the community each specific job and the work to be done according to a process within a certain timeline. However, I do not think it is reasonable, compared to the given time frame of 6 months to complete the project, the detailed plan takes place within 8 months. This took longer than expected to complete the project.
There was an error in the budget calculation for this project. It exceeded the budget requested by the team. The excess number is not a small number, so the project can be implemented or not. Should the community put their trust in this project to succeed? The team should reduce costs and should give an exact figure, not an approximation because it represents transparency.
The participants in the project were reviewed by the team and selected qualified people. They have pointed out the character and capacity of the people involved in the construction of the project. Not only that, they can also indicate their LinkedIn so that we can track and understand that person's information, which is very convincing to the community. I agree that if we are funded we will continue to work even further and scale up even more
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal identifies the goals that must be achieved to make the project successful, which are the products after the project implementation. The group showed the community that the event was open to the public. The indicators are given clearly and completely, consistent with the above disarmament, suitable for this challenge.
There is no denying the success of the project because the team has shown this success as a definition. Once the proposal is funded, the results will be clear, the Global South invested in and recognized as the frontline of climate change impacts and represented in the national dialogue and decision-making economic.

f6_assessments.q0: The project effectively addresses the challenge. True to the difficulty mentioned by the proposer, Africa is facing food crises which are mainly caused by the Ukraine war and the climate. Therefore, it is necessary to take measures to increase investment in the application of innovative technologies for food businesses and climate change in parallel with non-profit organizations. The solution proposed by the proposer is completely reasonable when the Grow Africa, Grow Cardano fund receives more attention, the number of proposals, the number of quality projects funded and the number of communities from Africa increase,. .. This has a positive impact on technology development in Africa, they absolutely have the opportunity to close the gap with the world by mastering and vigorously applying this funded technology. So I welcome this project.
f6_assessments.q1: The project roadmap is very practical, it helps me understand the amount of work that the team undertakes and the tasks assigned in each stage of the roadmap. A small request is that you add experts to participate in each work of the project, it will help me understand how you manage the project and assign work. Thank you for providing detailed information about the members and proof of their experience. They are all people with certain successes in related fields. I have no comment on this part of the proposal. The information provided is satisfactory. The requested budget is fully explained and consistent with the project scope.i rate this part highly.
f6_assessments.q2: Thank you for the detailed presentation of project progress metrics. Thanks to it will help me understand the project surveys to evaluate the effectiveness of the project. Hope you will pay attention to the continuous and transparent project progress update in the future. The proposer clearly articulated the long-term vision and vision of the project, geared towards investment and the recognition and promotion of business and technology development in Africa.

solution: Diversity of investments in Africa offers a diversity of solutions to global food, climate, and human rights crisis. Allowing accessible access to micro-credit funding will build this diversity.
experience: 30+ years of experience in climate and sustainability, building global networks, foundations, and environmental conservation. The last two years of SCC have reached 154 million impressions and political traction with the COP27 Presidency.
